full_text: All bounds in §15.2.4–§15.2.8 are stated for the regime $k_1=|\mathcal A(\mathcal S_1)|\ge 2$ (at least two alive walkers), with the "no self‑companion" convention (an alive walker samples companions from $\mathcal A\setminus\{i\}$). The edge case $k=1$ is handled separately in §15 (single‑survivor revival), after which analysis resumes with $k\ge 2$. Where intermediate formulas feature denominators $k_1-1$, they are interpreted under this precondition; if a generic statement is needed, replace $k_1-1$ by $\max(1, k_1-1)$ and invoke the $k=1$ section.
label: remark-cloning-scope-companion-convention
